biography.summary: John R. Curtis is a Republican U.S. Senator from Utah who previously served as the U.S. Representative for Utah's 3rd congressional district from 2017 to 2025. A businessman and former mayor of Provo, he focuses on economic growth, energy development, and national security.
biography.education: Attended Brigham Young University; earned degrees in business and economics.
biography.career: Businessman and public servant who served as Mayor of Provo, Utah, before being elected to the U.S. House of Representatives in 2017 and later elected to the U.S. Senate in 2024.

contact.office_address: 502 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Pro-business, supports tax relief and deregulation to spur growth.
Supports expanding domestic energy production and infrastructure.
Advocates strong defense and border security.

bills_sponsored.title: Energy Infrastructure Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Aims to streamline permitting for energy infrastructure projects.

bills_sponsored.title: Small Business Tax Reform Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Provides targeted tax relief to small businesses and startups.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives for Utah's 3rd district.
Sworn in as U.S. Senator from Utah; term begins.
